Posts.Content: Sometimes you just want someone to " listen "  AND   "hear  "  ....there may not be a " solution "  , but if you are worried .....then you are worried !  Being told your worries are groundless does not take them away .....my husbands answer to everything was " don`t worry ,it will be alright "  most of the time it was alright , the children passed exams / didn`t crash cars etc etc ,but 30 years of feeling " dismissed "  led to divorce........and once you have had a cancer diagnosis ,you are understandably worried to a certain extent .....that is NOT  hypochondria , but I try to get things in perspective too......Hope you start feeling better ,find someone you trust to talk to , you might find it helps .....best wishes
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: Really interested to see you say hanging from a door frame helped cording ....I hung from a climbing frame in the local park ,but was frightened to put that on here in case I did the " wrong thing "   !!!!  best of luck with it !
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Sometimes you just want someone to " listen "  AND   "hear  "  ....there may not be a " solution "  , but if you are worried .....then you are worried !  Being told your worries are groundless does not take them away .....my husbands answer to everything was " don`t worry ,it will be alright "  most of the time it was alright , the children passed exams / didn`t crash cars etc etc ,but 30 years of feeling " dismissed "  led to divorce........and once you have had a cancer diagnosis ,you are understandably worried to a certain extent .....that is NOT  hypochondria , but I try to get things in perspective too......Hope you start feeling better ,find someone you trust to talk to , you might find it helps .....best wishes
Posts.Title: sending myself crazy !

Posts.Content: Hi .....Wendy.....cording was slowly getting better with normal exercises .....a few weeks ???   Then it got worse again ......swimming helped a bit .....I realised I was " really "  stretching my shoulder .....so when I took my friends child to the playground I was showing her the monkey bars and realised it helped .....I have never told anyone as I am scared it was the wrong thing to do ......but I have gone back a few times since on my own !  No prob at all now ( 10 months post op )......touch wood ....best wishes....
Posts.Title: On the outside looking in

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite , that is interesting about exercizing the " bad " arm ........I have breast / chest wall lymphoedema and if I miss a few days swimming I get swelling in the armpit ....pre BC  I used to lift weights , perhaps I will ask my ( usually non committal ) onco tomorrow .... best wishes to you
Posts.Title: Partial or total lymph node clearance?

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite , that is interesting about exercizing the " bad " arm ........I have breast / chest wall lymphoedema and if I miss a few days swimming I get swelling in the armpit ....pre BC  I used to lift weights , perhaps I will ask my ( usually non committal ) onco tomorrow .... best wishes to you
Posts.Title: Partial or total lymph node clearance?

Posts.Content: Al hospitals seem to have different methods.....I had radio active jab one hour before op and blue dye in anaesthetic room.....BUT if you think errors have been made before I would want the reassurance of the exact plan......but I am very anxious anyway !  I hope you get it sorted out  and best wishes......
Posts.Title: Radio active dye during lymph node removal

Posts.Content: You are very likely to be getting the right Physical treatment ,but with lots of women going through every hospital they don`t always pay attention to your emotional and / or anxiety needs.........I am a worrier and have found some of the staff quite dismissive .........one breast cancer nurse just said " you have had all the treatment  there is no more we can do , remember you have got a GP  "....I think you would FEEL better if you were listened to ,and THAT is what matters really ......hope you get some answers......best wishes and good luck.....
Posts.Title: Finding it hard to trust my consultant

Posts.Content: I was completely on my own ......took myself back and forth to hospital , some of my chemo was in the run up to Xmas and friends were all involved with families , I spent a few days after one lot of chemo lying on the settee at night with the TV on as I could not sleep after steroids , just put a jug of water and the laptop , book , etc etc within reach and stayed there ! I think I would have worried more if I had had a dependant child in the house ...... Have you got good friends that can be relied on to pop in ?   I think I have read posts on here about people being on their own too .....good luck and best wishes .......x
Posts.Title: on your own with breast cancer chemotherapy

Posts.Content: When you are fed up, Ill, scared you  are bound to be sensitive ( not OVER  sensitive ) ,my bug bear is “ don’t worry “ when there IS something to worry about.......the physician who popped his head round the door when I was admitted with sepsis in December used this phrase.........I am sorry to say I replied “ if sepsis and incurable cancer aren’t a worry , what is ? “ ......I have no patience these days !  Sorry you are so fatigued Sal ......is the thyroid sorted ? You are so young , if you are not on chemo surely someone should be sorting this out ...... xx
Posts.Title: Fuming with comment from nurse in Chemo unit

Posts.Content: If you have never been in hospital before it is going to be an added stress on top of being diagnosed , but I am not at all sure why you think you will lose your belongings or have them stolen . I have been in 9 times for various things and never lost anything and I haven’t seen any posts about this being a problem . I also live alone . Have you got a friend to take you home ? If not the Red Cross might do it , depends where you live . All hospitals are different but mine won’t let you go home alone in a taxi . Have you been allocated a breast care nurse ? I think you need a lot of reassurance and some sensible information . I hope you have someone supporting you , my friends have been great and I find this thread so helpful. It is easy to fret about things , I am the worlds worst worrier , and I think you will find it easier when treatment is underway and you can see how well you can cope , really sending you best wishes and let us know how you get on. X
Posts.Title: Going into hospital

Posts.Content: My like button has disappeared! Just want to say sal , your post is perfect .....when the words incurable secondaries are mentioned it is the pits , but like you say ,there is life , just a different life . Hope your scan results are stable and you find the energy for a swim , it is great for aching ! Getting dressed after exhausts me ! so this warmer weather is good as it means less layers !  Callmebruce .......best wishes to you and your family , this disease is so sneaky but there is masses of reasearch and new treatments coming along all the time .....keep posting . best wishes for the bank holiday to all !  X
Posts.Title: Supporting partner though secondary BC

Posts.Content: I had the gas board out .....I was CONVINCED  I could smell gas   !!!!
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: I live alone , I have not needed physical help , but have appreciated a chat etc , I went on pretty much with my usual groups and routine through most of it , and that helped . Sorry to hear about your husband .....there are plenty of people on here who understand how scary this all is....best wishes
Posts.Title: living alone with breast cancer

Posts.Content: pleased to hear you eventually got help ....sometimes we need to be very proactive on our own account ......it took me 7 weeks to get 4 blood clots diagnosed !!!  I hope you can find a professional to trust ....best wishes
Posts.Title: what is the best Antibiotic for wound infection after mastectomy....

Posts.Content: Why do you think it is infected. ? Have you got a temperature ? Do you feel generally ill ?  You need a professional opinion about this .......better to check early than let things get worse.......best wishes and hope it is easily sorted......
Posts.Title: what is the best Antibiotic for wound infection after mastectomy....

Posts.Content: I went out this evening for the first time in ages and logged when I came home ,and expected LL  to have posted .....I was concerned too , pleased to see someone else flagging it up !  Good night everyone !
Posts.Title: London Lass

Posts.Content: This is not good enough !  If it is bone pain related to cancer can the oncology team offer advice about meds ?? There may be a " pain clinic " at your hospital ...but getting a referral can be hard work ....really hope you get someone to listen
Posts.Title: How to make GP understand that I'm struggling?

Posts.Content: I have got a swollen breast too , following all my treatment ......I am supposed to wear a compression bra night and day , but if I do the swelling " moves " to the arm pit and burns.......so I don`t always behave .....I did not expect to " end up " like this !!!
Posts.Title: Possible Mastitis?

Posts.Content: You cannot be more petrified than I was .....but it was ok .....not sick at all ....horrid taste in mouth ...lots of indigestion ....got a few probs now .but manageable !  Everyone is different ....lots of people have different experiences ,but I tell myself there might be people who weren`t badly affected and might not come on here for support...I found walking helped ......see how it goes and don`t pre-empt probs ....much easier said than done ....I am trying to take my own advice ......good luck and best wishes
Posts.Title: Chemo consult

Posts.Content: I am sure you have already thought of this ,but you could search on line under " camping/walking equipment with disability ..."  I think I remember that someone with an arm amputation did that in my walking group ( I know you are not that bad ....)  with best wishes
Posts.Title: Trivial I know in the grand scheme of things but....

Posts.Content: It probably will be trial and error ......but .......baby shampoo is not formulated for adult scalp /hair ....it is not " just gentle "  it works differently . Argon oil is very good , try combing conditioner ( or the oil ) through your hair very gently and leaving it for 10 mins befors shampooing very gently . Also some scalp issues are to do with nutrition ,esp iron stores and / or zinc ,which may have been affected by your chemo......I hope something works for you ,best wishes
Posts.Title: Dry, flaky, itch scalp since chemo.

Posts.Content: Seaspirit44 ......best wishes for the investigations starting next week , it is always scary !
Posts.Title: 2 primary cancers in three and half years.

Posts.Content: You wanted someone else grade three with lymph node involvement ...well here I am !  AND  to say I was petrified / terrified / panic stricken etc etc at the beginning does not begin to explain how I was !  It will be 3 years this October since I found the lump and I have had several ops .chemo , blood clots along the way , was bald with no eyelashes , radiotherapy .....and CT scans which freaked me out !!!  But here I am !  Since then I have travelled in Austalia , renovated a house , walked miles , made and sold crafts for the local scanner appeal ......and many other things too ,,,,,,I have ended up with osteoporosis ,but that is due to the hormone tablets ,and I think you are not having them ?  The " light at the end of the tunnel "  is not necessarily a train coming towards you ....I did not have to cope with young children through this and I expect someone else will answer who has ( and I think there is a group for younger women too .....) I understand some of your fear ,keep posting on here , it really helped me .....and I hope you have got emotional and practical help and support too .....best wishes ,,,,,
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - feel like I'm living a nightmare

Posts.Content: I have been following your thread from the start and it seems you are frustrated at every turn ,,,,,,,I think a lot of research shows poor sleep does not help physical or psychological health ......and you do seem to be on line at night sometimes .  I echo what some of the others say about finding the cause of the pain ,and the way I think about all issues of health is that general practitioners are just that ....general !  The NHS  is full of experts ,you just need to find the right ones and the hospice should have good specific knowledge ...and pharmacists are sometimes a good source of information ,,,,,,especially the ones that work in oncology or chronic pain management.......also the ideas about stretching / massage etc sound as if they might help ......can you do pilates or swimming or anything like that that might relax your mind as well as your body ??  I have been anxious all my life , chronic worry is draining ......do you think someone with time to listen would help  ?  I think ( I might have got it wrong ) that you have said you don`t want councelling at the moment ........your quality of life seems to be badly affected  at the moment and I really understand you want some answers , it is so frustrating , I am in awe of you working despite all this ,you are an inspiration ,I wish I could think of something that would help , you seem to get empathy on this site ,so at least that hopes a bit ......good luck
Posts.Title: HELP......

Posts.Content: When I retired from a busy job I joined lots of groups .....basically there is something in my diary for part of every day ( except Saturdays ) .....I am learning history and doing voluntary work  BUT  all this stops 23 / 12 and most of it does not resume until at least 3 / 1 / 2017   !!!!   I have no family , my friends are very good but all have husbands / grand children / other commitments ....which is perfectly reasonable !   At the time of year when it is dark at 1620 and I can`t do the garden !!  I told myself today "at least you are not in Alleppo "  "  Hope you all have a good Christmas and onwards and upwards for another year !
Posts.Title: Happiness vs Meaningfulness - an interesting article

Posts.Content: Londonlass....you are still caring about others as usual ....I have signed and sent on to all my e mail contacts  !
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Great flow chart ....you made my day
Posts.Title: JUST HAVING A LITTLE RANT HERE

Posts.Content: I came home from a shopping trip to find an unexpected  appointment on the mat , and completely lost the plot ! It is funny in retrospect........have a good day....x
Posts.Title: Appointments!

Posts.Content: Hi , WhatHappened and the others on this thread ......some time ago I read a trial / research project on “ 4 common and cheap drugs “ which can affect breast cancer ,they were a statin , metformin , aspirin and an anti microbial ( not an antibiotic as such but something used for worms ! ) can’t think of its name at the moment .......the point was they were all well understood as regards side effects etc and were easy to stop if necessary.....I was very interested in this , although generally I am not keen on more and more drugs ! Years ago I worked in with cardiovascular patients and also did some teaching and was very sceptical about statins being prescribed so widely on the back of the Farmington study , which lots of people thought had some areas of poor methodology........and in recent years the discussion of statins has gone on and on , but this use ( for cancer ) is a different discussion altogether.......and I still think it is interesting.......these drugs are off patent and cheap , maybe it will turn out to be helpful ? this is , of course ,just my opinion .....hope you have a good day ....x
Posts.Title: Is statin a good idea if now have high cholesterol 6.4, heard they...

Posts.Content: I said to someone yesterday that having chemo is like having a baby ,,,,,beforehand there are always people wanting to tell you how bad it is ......but often it is NOT  !  Everyones experience is different.....what you are like as a person matters much more than what you LOOK like......best wishes and good luck
Posts.Title: Decca Aitkenhead in the Guardian

Posts.Content: I had my pic removed after the 3 fec.t as I had clots around it . They used the veins in the back of my hand for the 3 docetaxol , which they said was less harmful to veins .....it was ok ......best wishes .....x
Posts.Title: Picc lines

Posts.Content: I totally agree with you , I don’t go to the cinema and have not seen this advert , but I do know what you mean when you say once something is in your head you can’t blank it . I record most tv and fast forward through adverts ....! Hope you see some good films and that this fades ......best wishes. X
Posts.Title: MacMillan adverts in cinema

Posts.Content: Ali owl and grannylara, this disease really is S### isn’t it ? I am getting CT results Tuesday too, I freak out when I see the Dr, I never know what the next lot of bad news will be ( I ever expect good ! )    Did a lot of gardening today , helps me feel “ normal “ and I suppose it is denial    ,!!     Best wishes to you
Posts.Title: PALB2

Posts.Content: I was advised to use a very gentle shampoo , but I was told not to use baby shampoo as the oils in adult scalp skin is not the same as a child , though I know others have been given other advice .......You might want to prepare your child that your hair might not come back the same . I had thin straight fair hair below my shoulders and it has come back thick mousey and curly.....I am having to think how to style it , as this was something I ever used to do !!  Best wishes
Posts.Title: Hair Loss - Question about regrowth.

Posts.Content: So pleased to see this thread ......my hand got puffy at xmas , lymphoedema nurse fitted me with very tight bra " corset " and sleeve and glove .My arm has never really ached . I am slim , I swim most days , but apparently I have been doing " too much " typing ,knitting , sewing , driving , swimming etc etc .......in fact most things I like !  She has warned me about pruning shrubs and cutting grass as these are " too repetitive " ....I am anxious at the best of times and this has floored me , I was looking for " hope " that this was not going to progress quckly to a fat arm or cellulitis ( oncologist warning ) .....I used to be able to forget cancer for a couple of hours at a time , now I am constantly aware , the bra is so uncomfortable , I " cheated " and went back to my sports bra today , Can someone give me hope ? I know I am being silly and so many of you are putting up with so much , thank you all for keeping me going . x
Posts.Title: Compression sleeve for prevention?

Posts.Content: Depends what it is like .....does it feel like it is fluid filled ?? It could be a seroma ( common )  .....as it is a week day perhaps someone at the hosp will have a quick look ? Some units like to drain them ,others favour re absorbtion over time ......but we are told to report changes / worries ....hope you get some reassurance ....( I am a " worrier "  too )  best wishes......
Posts.Title: Lump under arm after op

Posts.Content: Wigs can be refurbished and re used at the following charities ....Wigbank, 40 George St , Perth , PH1  5JL or Hull and East Riding breast friends , Suite D1 , Chamberlain Business Centre , Chamberlain Rd , Hull , HU8 8HL.... I hope these details are still current ,I was given them last year Best wishes to all !
Posts.Title: Squeezing some good out of this nasty disease

Posts.Content: ALSO “ at least your children are grown up “.   And .....well you are better off than your friend who is going blind .......believe me I KNOW     !    Good luck x
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: I went along with my breast care nurse .....she said she had made me an appointment with the hair people ,so I went and got a wig very like my hair .....had to add £90 to the money NHS  gave plus £12 for shampoo and conditioner .....I am techno - hopeless and E bay / Amazon did not occur to me .   I wore the wig 5 times   ( it was xmas !  )  and wore hats all through the cold winter ....If there was somewhere I could donate it I would be pleased to know........good luck to all of you
Posts.Title: Rage at the Wigs!

Posts.Content: Keep doing the arm exercises ......that will help the fluid shift ......it might take a long time ,don`t panic .   If the wound has completely healed you can massage AROUND  the edges with bio oil, very gently .....not rubbing ....and not on the scar line unless the Dr / nurse says you can ,,,,,,,my scar line is softening quite a lot now , it was very lumpy .....I have heard a year is not unusual.......I think you sound a bit like me ....there is always something new to worry about .?!.....I hope you get some reassurance ....your other news sounds very positive.......happy Christmas
Posts.Title: Tell me about your scars

Posts.Content: Such a good thread , I was also told by the breast care nurse that the type of BC I have is the “ easiest to treat . “ we 3 times this week I have been told about turmeric tablets..... I reply asking them to watch the Michael Mosley research into “ bioavailability “ then come back to me .  On the other hand I do get in first with my comments.....” I am having a bad hair day “ etc etc .....and when I treat walking friends to coffee I point out how much I am saving on shampoo and razors and mascara ......luckily they all accept my black humour and usually say “ well , I will have cake too , then “  when I shared my “ incurable “ diagnosis one friend said “ doctors don’t know everything “  hope you all have a good day , keep warm and try to forgive them “ they know not what they say “ as the Good Book puts it !! Xxx
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: I think that there are so many of us going through this that the hosp staff SOMETIMES  don`t understand how anxious some of us are .....when I was told about side effects of chemo and radio I expected to get all of them and was really freaked out.....I am very anxious at the best of times .......BUT  I sailed through radio ....no burns  ....skin not changed colour .shape not changed......it has made my breast / chest lymphoedema a bit worse but it is fine really .......then they started me on letrozole and that set me off again worrying about a long list of side effects .......Hope you get someone to listen to your worries ...the radio people or a nurse ?  This is what you need.......hope you look back and find it was all ok ......good luck ......
Posts.Title: Minimising radiotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: I have (unexpected ) and proven osteoporosis and am on Alendronic acid ,after reading about this IV  bisphosphonate I rang my breast unit to ask if it would be " better "  and was told that just because I read about things it doesn`t mean they work !!!!  Best wishes to all of you ,,,,,
Posts.Title: biphosphonates

Posts.Content: Interesting about Circulating cells ......I am getting more and more sure that secondaries need to be found as early as possible ( I had no symptoms, so got to a critical stage before treatment began ) there seems to minimal input to research / BCNs......or perhaps this is just my thought .   Best wishes
Posts.Title: Chemo or not to chemo invasive lobular cancer

Posts.Content: Hi youngstheart.....I think they sort of drip feed you with information , my cousin didn’t ask any questions and 4 years later she still has no clue why she got the treatment they gave her ! I asked everything, but I still had the impression they were only telling me a bit at a time while they worked how I was reacting....I think that the chemo depends on what they find in the lymph nodes , I am her negative and I had chemo . There is a “ ask the nurse “ section on here which might help you , and then if you wanted , you could ask to see the dr and have a list of questions to put your mind at rest   Best wishes
Posts.Title: How much information should you be told

Posts.Content: Good luck and best wishes ......hope you will not have to wait ages to find out what it is ? I haven`t slept either ......seeing oncologist this pm .......it never ends does it ?????
Posts.Title: 2hrs Sleep....

Posts.Content: Reading the posts it is so interesting so many of us worked for NHS ....( stress and / or shifts ?) .....at my local hospital 6 out of 7 night sisters had / have BC and 3 ward managers ( that I know of ) and 4 of my friends have siblings with BC .....So I guess it IS  common !?....which is worrying for so many families affected ......best wishes to you all
Posts.Title: Amount of people with breast cancer

Posts.Content: The " e"  part of FEC  is a known risk factor for clots ....so is a PICC.....so is having cancer . You should not be in so much pain that you are distressed .....I had clots of blood around my Picc for 7 weeks while I was reassured for my extreme " anxiety "   ( I AM  v anxious )  Is your neck " puffy "  ????  I was misdiagnosed originally with an ear infection..... YOU  may not have clots and I don`t want to panic you , but PLEASE  make someone you trust take notice ( and preferably an ultrasound or Doppler ! ).......I really hope that it will settle down and be nothing to worry about ,but  felt I must answer your post.....best wishes and good luck
Posts.Title: Why is my PICC a Pain...???

Posts.Content: Oh how awful Andi ......I have been thinking about you since your first post.......when I first replied I hoped I was being over cautious ....sorry to hear it turned out so bad .  Hope the rest of your cancer treatment goes much better and that the care team are very careful and good with you !!!  So scary for you .....best wishes for the rest of it ......
Posts.Title: Why is my PICC a Pain...???

Posts.Content: Hi  Andi3xx........I have been thinking about you and hoping that your Picc line was ok and got sorted out ........best wishes
Posts.Title: Why is my PICC a Pain...???

Posts.Content: Surgery is the best treatment for cancer ......it has been " removed ". (  assuming the margins were clear ?)  Chemotherapy theoretically " mops up " cells which have escaped vie lymph or blood vessels.......any scans after treatment ends would only show tumours large enough to be seen ,,,,and it is said that this is only a " snapshot " of that day ......assuming the scan was clear the temptation would be to want another one after a while " to be sure again "  ......we are nearly all of us in this boat ,waiting and hoping  , I suppose the main thing is to monitor the original site ( but try not to get too obsessed , it will change as it settles and scars up ) and report any new symptoms promptly ......that is the time when you will get scans " to rule OUT  spread ,as much as to find it ).....I suppose you can ask for a scan now / talk to your oncologist / but some scans involve radiation ,which carries its own risk..  After this diagnosis we are different people ,you are still very new to it , find a professional you trust and tell them everything .  I hope things go well for you .....I expect someone else will pop up soon to say something different  !!
Posts.Title: Male Breast Cancer- chemo then what?!

Posts.Content: Great thread on walking ....am a luddite , so can`t post pics , but always read all your posts......walked 3 miles today in MUD MUD MUD ........and for about 5 mins it was snowing ......but so cold .......had a nice coffee after with the group till we dried out ..... I am convincing myself it is good exercise ....! Lets keep it up !
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi .....all your pics are great ,I love the sea too .....3 weeks ago I was walking by it in Australia ....the cold since I came back has been a shock ! I walk 3 or 4 miles every day , recently in MUD .....got quite dispirited yesterday evening to read that sitting down / watching TV  for over one hour a day raises cancer risk .....surely we can`t be on our feet ALL day ?? I like sewing and knitting , I have lots of friends /aquaintences who do NO exercise.....are older than me , and do not have cancer . Also .....I have given up crisps for Lent too .....lets stick to it !! Best wishes to you all
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: I had kinesiology taping for a short while ......perhaps if you put this in the box you will get any old posts that mention it .....sorry ....not techy
Posts.Title: arm bandaging for lympodema

Posts.Content: It wasn’t so much a “ walk “ today, more a paddle on pavements ........I hadn’t dried out before I had to walk home     ! Hope Gareth goes away soon .......x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: love that little story ….. went on long walk yesterday ….nearly 5 miles I start chemo today and wanted one last walk with my group xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: The hospital would save time and money if they listened to you in the first place ! Hospital pharmacies are funny places , last time I was admitted I was given a script to take to pharmacy on the waout .......waited ages then they said you can’t get this here you must go to Boots .....went there and they would not do it either as the sticky name label partly obscured the date stamp ......I had mini ,polite , tantrum and they rang my oncology clinic and agreed to do it .......best wishes with everything x ( why odd emoticons ?).....
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Went on regular group walk today , really missed them over Christmas.....only a couple of miles , plus coffee and chat . Made me feel so much better .65 people turned up ! Beautiful sunny , bitterly cold day . I saw the “ big C and me “ bloggers on tv this am , and their New Years resolution was to “ stay alive “ .....they are such an inspiration..... heres to another year of exercise in the fresh air ....best wishes to all. X
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: It was snowing quite hard at 0800 , but it didn’t last ......I went to the meeting point for the organised Wednesday walk , by then it was dry . But the leader decided to cancel it as the council insures us and they were being “ safe “ ......about 50 people had turned up , so there was a bit of hoo haa turning cars round on a field .... i asked my friend if she was still keen for exercise,and we came back to my village and had a long ( muddy ) walk.....I can’t swim today because the pool is shut for lessons , I am trying not to think about my CT results next week ....I am looking forward to better weather and more walks , I love looking at all your pictures...x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Just been catching up with the pod cast “ you me and the big C” , the one on exercise , inspirational !! But I don’t think I will be running a marathon anytime soon .......x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: This year I have walked 8 weeks in snow , 18 in heat , and forthe last few weeks through thick mud and flood water .....it is nearly myanniversary of being told I have secondary and I honestly think my walking group have kept me going ......I read all your posts and hope you all keep having greatwalks through another year , I shall put one foot in front of the otheras long as I can !!! Hope you all have a good day
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh, seaspirit , what a disaster. Living alone my fear is always burst pipes , power cuts , sky dish failure etc etc .......I could worry about anything ! cats drive me mad , they scratch my gate , dig holes in flower beds and leave messes on the lawn , the lawn mower gets contaminated and the shed stinks ..... SORRY to all of you who love them ......have a good day ......x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: You are all doing so well with your walks , I am a Luddite ,so no counting steps or posting pictures ! Did 5 miles yesterday , started in fog and finished in sunshine , beautiful !  So pleased someone is in touch with mrsox , seems like ( cautious ) good news at the moment ..... best wishes to all of you
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Love the stories of your walks , wish it was snowing here ! Did a 6 and a half mile walk yesterday , then ruined it by having a pub lunch ! There was a walk organised today too , but I could not go because I was having a CT .....but I joined them for lunch ( 2 different groups ! ) ...which was cheeting a bit wasn’t it !!  I can’t post pictures but Lou looking at yours .....lets all keep going .......x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Loving this thread ....great believer in " green gym "  for mental health . Yesterday was going out to a group walk , started near my house so I jogged there ......afterwards I went swimming , then walked to my hosp appointment to have my " lumpy scar " checked ....it turned out to be ok , thank goodness , but I have some cording and the nurse said it would help if I could manage some exercise.......this made me laugh , thought you might too !!!  best wishes !
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Gosh ! What a saga , you have done 2 weeks worth of good turns !   x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi s10.......did you have lymph nodes removed ?? this could be lymphoedema ?  Sorry you are feeling low ....best wishes
Posts.Title: I'm so scared

Posts.Content: I am about as terrified / anxious as anyone  .....I have found none of my treatment was quite as bad as I feared .....a LOT  of people on here have described rads as the easiest bit ........it was the worry which affected my quality of life and the constant reassurance that I was too worried rather than actual physical things that happened .......Anyway lots of people get through with no problems and I have told myself that they might not post as much as the people who DO get problems ,,,,because they are sharing help and support.......I am pale skinned and did not even go a bit red......I showered with water only ....and used Aveeno cream ( my usual ).....  in the last week of the rads I swam  ( advice from lymphoedema nurse )  and agreed by radiographer after looking at my skin ..  Also on BBC yesterday there were women talking about the damage they sustained from treatment in the 70`s which does not happen now due to advances in the machines.......but I really empathise about " worry " and the feeling you are being a bit " dismissed "  I hope you get through without problems , and that you can find someone who will listen to you ( we all need to be heard ?).....best wishes
Posts.Title: Question I have post to Ask a Radiotherapist

Posts.Content: Sorry ...got in a muddle with technology as usual ....I was trying to " agree " with FrancesW......
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hope everything is getting sorted with your brother violetsniff anjack, I posted to you yesterday but it vanished , was just thinking about a pal who had a ( non cancer ) wound that wouldn’t heal and she got a nutrition assessment and was short of zinc among other things ....hope things improve soon  weeblemum your knitting is fab , the dancers are so lucky . sal , hope you are feeling a bit better ? It is horrible to feel useless , but you aren’t , because you keep us all going !  Seaspirit , love the idea of swimming outdoors , it will soon be warmer ....( I hope )  best wishes to all of you today ........me x
Posts.Title: Newbie looking for some gentle support

Posts.Content: I agree with every word of this .......MacMillan came to our ( non cancer ) group and talked about wills / fundraising etc etc ,the conversation afterwards was about how much they " spend " .......I raise money for a local appeal to update a scanner.....I am sure cancer charities do wonderful work , but there must be other ways than shaving your head ( perhaps having very long hair cut short and donated as some have done ???) I hope my comments don`t upset anyone .....best wishes to you all
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Ok , so you noticed I posted in the wrong thread ! Can someone techy move it ???!! me x
Posts.Title: Newbie looking for some gentle support

Posts.Content: Yes it is annoying ....when I was diagnosed I was cross because I thought I had not done anything " wrong "  ....but actually all they are saying is it is reducing your risk .....not getting rid of ALL risk .....and it is true .......I was a " TOFI  "  ( thin outside / fat inside )  I had fat around my organs although I looked slim .....and however annoyed I was ,it WAS a risk factor ( for post menopausal oestrogen )  not all breast cancers are the same as we know and none of us are to " blame "  but lifestyle must play a part in a lot of diseases......and help us cope with the treatment ????  ( ignore the papers !!!  )
Posts.Title: Newspaper article re cancer

Posts.Content: I am following your thread ,so I know you see lots of " experts " ,but have you thought about a TENS machine ? Just a thought.......I really believe sleep is vital !    best wishes
Posts.Title: Ideas on coping with backache....

Posts.Content: Consider cutting it very short ......it will start dropping in your drinks , the washing up ,the showers , backs of chairs ,car seats etc etc !!i wore a beanie to bed otherwise there was hair everywhere in the morning and I resorted to vacuuming pillow cases .......but I am saving a fortune on razors and shampoo and mascara .....it is horrible , but if it is helping us live .........(!) ........losing my eyelashes has been the worst for me , apart from looking like an egg , my eyes run all the time ......I make fun of it and my friends have rallied round .....all the very best to anyone on here going through this xxx
Posts.Title: Morning! Ah the shredding has begun.

Posts.Content: Brilliant explanation ....wish the hosp team had been so clear in the beginning ......not sure I have got ALL my info yet,they seem to be drip feeding it .....and they never seem to come up with any HOPE  ( I asked them last time ,but they just smiled and suggested I read a book or watched a box set )....best wishes to you all ....
Posts.Title: Natural v Chemo

Posts.Content: Message above was for jmp , I am being useless tonight ...sorry
Posts.Title: Cancer’s back

Posts.Content: Once it is shut it is shut I am afraid . If it is too difficult to take it ,get a Tupperware and decant when you get back ( carefully ) .....have a good trip
Posts.Title: sharps bin.. possibly silly question!

Posts.Content: HHi MamaSm.......I am on capecitabine 4 tabs twice a day too and my feet are burning tonight ....interested to hear that someone can stay on it with a reduced dose . Have your scans shown that it is effective ? I am getting scan results next Monday and want hope ! Hope you are getting on ok ( ish ) , I agree that there is not enough put into secondary cancer , I was also told that 1 in 3 people might get spread , and I have always wondered since why I did not get annual CT ( or something ) as mine was “ aggressive “ .....best wishes
Posts.Title: Cancer’s back

Posts.Content: Hi London Lass …..I am sorry to hear news about your friend . I hope you are reading the Thought for the day thread , I hope you found someone today to offload to …..me  x
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Jmp.......I don’t know how old you are, but as you are retired have you heard of U3a, several people I know found great friends there , and it is not scarily academic as it sounds ,.......best wishes  x
Posts.Title: Single & Life with Cancer

Posts.Content: Congratulations .....I know how you feel .....I never really minded about my hair ,but I really missed my eyelashes .....I now find my favourite mascara was discontinued while I wasn`t buying it !!!
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: This is a scary time and we have all been there , although 30th October seems ages to you it is not really ......from now on , whatever happens you will learn things “ take a fortnight “....for an appointment , then maybe for a “ plan “ , then maybe to start treatment ,I was assured cancer does not spread that rapidly ......I tried to believe them .  Even if the nodes in your neck are spread from a breast cancer it does not necessarily mean the cancer has got any further , the nodes are there to do just this . It is very hard to take one step at a time , but the experts are dealing with this all the time and will make you a plan , and if ( it is IF ) there has been spread , it does not necessarily mean a bad prognosis ..... you have been given a CT early on , though you do not say how much of you was scanned,they seem to be moving fairly quickly at your hospital . There is a lot to take in , but there are lots of people on here who can explain things , and more importantly listen to your fears ....we “ get it “ ......best wishes and let us know how you get on .....x
Posts.Title: Breast lump - frightened and miserable.

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear this has happened to you after all your other set backs ......I had trouble with my PICC from the day after it was put in ,,,,pain first then swelling ,,,,,arm was a bit blue ,,,,neck was puffy etc etc ,all of which I was convinced were classic signs of a clot .....I was seen by a total of nine professionals who felt my neck / flushed the line etc etc and reassured me ( I always come across as anxious ) ........at one point I was given antibiotics for the puffy neck in case it was an ear infection .......anyway after 7 weeks I insisted on more investigation and sat in the cancer centre all day ,having scans etc and waiting for results......answer 4 clots !!!!  PICC out and straight onto anticoagulants ........I have had no after effects so I hope you get sorted out really quickly and are treated well .....best wishes ....
Posts.Title: Blood Clot in PICC line

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn ......you sent me  a friend request ...I think it was on this thread , I am technologically a luddite and have totally failed trying to accept it ....sorry .....best wishes  x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi .....I have been following your path from day one and really hoped you would succeed...but at least you had the courage most of us do not have . i understand that most clinics have now dropped “ f “ from fec in a lot of cases , so that means less side effects ....... if the taxol you are having is paclitaxol you might not find that too bad , I am on it weekly and am fine .....I had docetaxol first time round and that was worse than this  I think if you start reading the chemo threads you have about 20 years reading to catch up ( joke ) but it is very helpful . i have been walking miles and doing other exercise and I am told that this can help chemo to work ( sorry can’t remember who told me about the research )....I have no idea if it does ! But I like doing it . Anyway , it helps my mental health , just offer this to you as an idea to think about . hope you get an easy ride , and post on “ your “ thread so I ( we ) can follow you  best wishes. X
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi .......I had the liver biopsy , they wanted to know if the secondary was the same as the primary,or perhaps changed to Her positive , so they would know which chemo was best  despite being about the most anxious person on the planet I am still here to tell the tale !  They did frighten me a lot with their “ risks “ including , as you say , bleeding ......but it was actually ok , hurt straight afterwards ,wanted me to lie on my side , but when I got on my back it was ok , a bit of spasm pain , he said it irritated the capsule , I was in the ward about 3 hours , then got dressed , and because I live alone I stayed in overnight , slept right through and came home 0900 , didn’t take any pain killers ,not even paracetamol . but I can see that the anticoagulants are a problem ......I think you might need to decide who you trust ......I suppose they are gathering information to get you the best treatment ,but if you are not happy , I suppose you can refuse , it is your health , your life , your worry and you have done a lot of research .......best wishes anyway ........x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Chloecat …….haven`t heard much from you lately , just wondering how you are getting on …...Hope things are improving Best wishes …..
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi , pleased to see you posting .......you might find the “ bruising “ from the tinzparin injections is due to low platelets ( from paclitaxol ) .....you should only be bleeding from capillaries I hope and not veins .......but of course , ask a medic ! Best wishes......Also , I just wonder if you have looked at keeping your hands and feet cold during paclitaxol, I have no idea if this stops peripheral neuropathy , but it wasn’t mentioned to me until too late .....,again , please ask someone ! X
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn ,a great ,well reasoned post as usual .......as for questioning things " only dead fish swim with the tide "   !!!  Best wishes
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Pleased you are coping, I didn’t have debilitating side effects with my primary chemo , I did stop taking the ondansterone as it affected my gut ! Have you told the oncologist about your supplements ? Mine told me I could continue ,except for bit k 2 , which I felt was useful to get the bit D into the bones ( already have osteoporosis ).......I hope you continue to feel reasonably well , and more importantly the nasty little critter disappears .....best wishes  x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: I was pleased to see your update , I have followed your story from the start and you were so interesting in Birmingham.......I had all the conventional treatment , and here I am , 3 years later full of secondaries and incurable .......5 weeks ago I was supposed NED. , the world has fallen in on me .......I want to hear some success stories and I hope and pray you are one of them ......whatever happens ...enjoy your birthday xx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Fascinating !......I agree mental wellbeing is vital , and they just don`t seem to " get it " . I have 3 inconsistances in my notes , 2 of which I have had corrected . So pleased your bone scan is negative .  Have you thought about writing a book ??  Hope you go on doing well  x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Some of the side effects of chemo come out of the blue and the team just look at you blank ! If you were deeply asleep when you got up you might have dropped your blood pressure …..there is something called " micturition syncope " where people feel faint ……( so many things have got nice complicated names !!! ) ...but it is reassuring that you were checked over and nothing found …..after all , you were trying to avoid this nasty toxic stuff …...lets hope it is being as nasty to the critters as it is to you …...best wishes …..
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: I am so upset by this .......there are always options , but you sometimes can’t see them when you are being demoralised like this . No one should be bullied like this at work , and if you have cancer you need all your rescouces to be as healthy as possible . You do not say what sort of organisation you work for,but is there a line manager or HR department ? Do you have friends , or work colleagues who can support you ? Please don’t consider your options about further treatment based on this job ......try Macmillan financial advice , there might be someone at your cancer centre who can help , if not your hospital will be able to give you advice , and citizens advice can tell you about benefits , it sounds like you need to get away from this man , whatever treatment you are offered , you are worth more than this , look after yourself  , take as much advice as you need , but I really hope someone is supporting you ....best wishes with everything x
Posts.Title: Potentially stupid question - Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: I agree with ALL of you !  Being thin is not the same as being healthy is not the same as being fit !  Many of my acquaintences are on various restrictive diets with " clubs "  and are losing lots of pounds ( unfortunately it is pounds sterling , paying to be weighed , and buying endless books / plates / charts )......If you can dig it out of the ground , pick it from a tree , cut it off an animal or catch it in the sea , it is food .....everything else is made in a factory , leave it there !  Good luck to all of you ....x
Posts.Title: Green coffee extract

Posts.Content: Hi....the liver is in a capsule of connective tissue , it doesn’t expand much ,so if there is swelling in the liver it gets irritated , the needle going through the capsule and the ( very slight ) bleeding irritates it too ....i was told it would resolve in 24 hours , you can get shoulder tip pain too , because of the way nerves are routed.  The nurses were willing to give me morphine if needed , and said about half the patients need it . You need to be with someone for 24 hours in case you bleed , my thought was ....even if someone stays here with me ,how soon could I get to hospital if needed  ?!! So I stayed in .....they will talk to you about the anticoagulants ,the liver is a very vascular organ , I am sure you will pester for all the info ! Good on you , best wishes ..x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Has anyone checked your vit B levels ???
Posts.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy

Posts.Content: What are you like usually ....do you catch colds easily. ?  You might be in contact with colds at this time of year if you don't go ?? I understand your dilemma ...it's a difficult choice......best wishes .....
Posts.Title: Colds and visitors.

Posts.Content: So pleased to hear some good news .....best wishes x
Posts.Title: Thickening in right boob

Posts.Content: My onco told me letrozole causes " morning sickness "  .....I didn`t have that while I was pregnant ,but I do feel sick most days after breakfast now........hope you get some help
Posts.Title: SICKNESS / NAUSEA 5 MONTHS AFTER CHEMO & RADIOTHERAPY

Posts.Content: As far as I know " magic cream " is a local anaesthetic , they put  a blob on about 20 mins before using a needle and it numbs the area ….they use it a lot in children . But if they can`t find a vein where they put the cream ,it might mean retrying , and if that was me I would be getting more phobic......I hope the team looking after you realise how bad your anxiety is ,and are patient , unfortunately " being ill " often means needles etc etc …….have they explained the other options to you ?  I hope you get this sorted out , best wishes  x
Posts.Title: Magic Cream or Gas for General Anaesthetic

Posts.Content: GOSH  !!  your fear and reaction is NOT  for no reason ,this is a scary diagnosis !  It is true that many / most women will be treated successfully but it IS  CANCER  !  Of course you are upset !  The treatment will have added to your normal reactions ,lack of oestrogen takes a bit of adjusting to .........I think that there is such an optimistic outlook about this disease in the general population that it is easy to underestimate the shock and worry of it , Sometimes being told " it will be ok "  or " keep strong "  is just so irritating .....( well , it was to me !) If you feel rubbish find someone to talk to who will not dismiss your fears , or downplay the seriousness , keep reading the posts on here .....I hope they help you like they help me .....best wishes   x
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: That is VERY  interesting .......I find exercise helps with anxiety , and a suggestion that there is research showing it actually might affect recurrence is great .....is swimming on the list ?  Is 100 lengths a week enough ??  The oncologist  / breast care nurse gave me no lifestyle advice .......great ....thank you   x
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hi to JBELLE  ....I THINK (?)  you sent me a friend request , I am technically useless , hope I replied properly .....best wishes
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hi to JBELLE  ....I THINK (?)  you sent me a friend request , I am technically useless , hope I replied properly .....best wishes
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: I lived on strong mints   !!!  Good luck ….x
Posts.Title: Wind

Posts.Content: Please get this checked today, it could be a clot or infection , are you checking your temperature ... ?  Best wishes
Posts.Title: Pain in arm chemo fec was given 9 dsys ago

Posts.Content: Did you have lymph nodes removed ??? All that activity might be causing lymhoedema ?     Worry really is awful......
Posts.Title: massive panic! please don't hate me.

Posts.Content: I did my own ( largish ) garden through all my treatment .....but after my lymph node removal I was not supposed to " use " that arm for " ironing / vacuuming etc "  I told the nurse I do very little of that , but can I cut the grass .....! ?  answer was , don`t use that arm , I did struggle ,but of course it was not my livelihood ......Longish term after lymph node removal I developed breast / chest wall lymphoedema .....Again there were lots of dire warnings about carrying bags / heavy housework etc , I still do a certain amount of digging ,but if I am honest I probably shouldn`t ,,,,and repetitive things like pruning with secatuers noticeably increases my symptoms. There was / is also the issue of infection , bites , scratches , thorns , etc etc ......supposed to wear long sleeves and tough gloves , must admit I forget sometimes and so far have got away with it ..... I hope someone who knows better pops up soon to give you advice rather than my rambling !!!  Best wishes  x
Posts.Title: Chemo and working and a gardener

Posts.Content: I am so sorry you are feeling so " down "  . I hope you will be able to bounce back soon .......and your scan results come back without anything new to worry about , and you are managing to sleep ......best wishes ........
Posts.Title: Feelings.......

Posts.Content: I was petrified ......I did not find this forum until after a bit of treatment .....and it would have helped !   FIRSTLY ,,,,stay away from Dr Google !!!    Lots of people will tell you that .  I fell apart when I was told I needed scans and chemo ....but it was ok (ish ) and I am still here and still anxious !  You might also find yourself supporting everyone else and remarks along the lines of " I am sure you will be ok "  are very irritating ,,,,,it feels as if your fears are being dismissed .  You will also be told about a lot of other people who had cancer and are still here as if the next few weeks can be ignored !!  Remember you have not been diagnosed yet  , and you might be able to stop your brain going into overdrive ( I couldn`t and can`t ! )  but there is lots of help and support  IF  it turns out you need treatment .....and if you have always been worried about health tell the people you see how you feel .....you will not be the only one  !!!  Best wishes .good luck etc etc   !!!!
Posts.Title: Coping With the Waiting !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: I am so sorry to hear you were treated like this ,was there a nurse present ? Because of your aunt you are understandably worried . I got “ labelled “ as over anxious at the start of my “ journey” , and unfortunately that lead to me being falsely “ reassured “ when various things cropped up , like 4 clots of blood !!    Is there any way you can self refer for an urgent mammogram ? Could you ring the breast unit and explain your symptoms ?  I hope you have got some understanding support ,let us know how you get on , hopefully yours will be a short stay on this site ......best wishes
Posts.Title: Pain in my left breast - consultant not interested

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear this , mine came back in the liver and surgery is not an option , will they give you chemo ?? hopefully someone with something sensible to say will come on line , I just wanted you to know you are not alone ......best wishes
Posts.Title: Breast cancer - axillia

Posts.Content: The side effects  of new tabs always sends  me into a flat spin........but I am fine on letrazole ( more or less !).....you are being asked to do 3 or 4 things which mess with your body chemistry and whatever you decide you have to live with it .....BUT  you are NOT  " weak ".... cancer is a big deal......you need to take in and process all the info......how you cope is individual to you ....please don`t beat yourself up ....best wishes .......
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy & Hormone treatment positive lymph node

Posts.Content: Was thinking about you yesterday, pleased to see you are still on forum , hope you are doing really well.   X
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?

Posts.Content: Hi Stevie Q I was totally shocked to find on my scan before starting letrazole that I had osteoporosis , I had always done a lot of exercise . In my life I knew people got cancer out of the blue , but I had never thought I was at risk of osteoporosis !!  A couple of thoughts ......have you rung the osteoporosis helpline / joined their forum ? Also I read a lot and I think that Vit D with Calcium might not be " enough " if you already have osteoporosis ......to get calcium into bones you need VitK2 , magnesium , boron , possibly zinc.......but please research this for yourself .......Also be aware that few Drs have ever heard of K2 .......but there are lots of posts on this site about it .  Wishing you good luck for the new year ....
Posts.Title: Letrozole/bone scan and Osteoporosis

Posts.Content: I think the expression “ contained “ means it is only in t breast ( lymph nodes are there to catch cells that try to escape , so they might have done their job ) mine had “ escaped “ and was in the blood stream ( not contained ) ........it is a massive shock , but you will find information here , most people avoid Dr google as he is scary and out of date ! The only other thing I would say is , don’t be surprised if plans change , it does not mean anything sinister .....I flew into a total panic about a CT scan I wasn’t expecting , and they just looked at me and said “ it’s routine “ .......since then they have changed their minds so many times as information comes in ,that I have calmed down ...! very best wishes. X
Posts.Title: recently diagnosed 2cm lesion possible 1 lymph node (Borderline)

Posts.Content: I am sorry no one was awake to answer you , hope you got some sleep . Unfortunately there is no way any of us can say what this is ,and it is only a couple of hours now to ring for help  possibly you need to see GP ( be assertive with receptionist ) you don’t need this worry over a weekend ! Radiotherapy can cause all sorts of issues ...... good luck and best wishes x
Posts.Title: Worried about lump

Posts.Content: Kathleen 37 ......so pleased you are sounding more positive after last weeks posts .....swimming really is great , I love being in water , good wishes for a healthy future !!
Posts.Title: Guys, in a bit of a panic regarding diet - of all things!!!

Posts.Content: Hi , the whole issue of diet and cancer is a minefield . It is also awful that so many BCN s seem to be overworked and unhelpful. I think they cannot advocate things which are not in NICE guidelines . Personally I doubt anything you do in the very short term is going to affect your cancer drastically . I took the letrazole religiously and ate a good diet and still got secondaries . I think the whole of your treatment plan is more important than one issue . And stressing about it is probably not a good thing for your metabolism of nutrients !?  Fad diets are always hard to maintain . I don’t know if you would consult a nutritionist ?  The only thing I have been told is that asparagus and grapefruit can be oestrogenic , and I ate a lot of grapefruit all my life ( and miss it )  ,and some hospitals seem to telling patients this when they take letrazole , and some don’t. Anyway , you probably put on any excess weight over a long period , so don’t beat yourself up about losing it quickly ......best wishes for everything...x
Posts.Title: Guys, in a bit of a panic regarding diet - of all things!!!

Posts.Content: So sorry you feel like this , you are so right , many people feel that once treatmentends you are at sea....I tell myself the help has moved on to the vast amounts of new patients starting treatment....they might be overwhelmed? inorder to reassure myself I went on a trial, which meant more monitoring, unfortunately when that showed up a potential problem that was not acted on quickly.......but they have swung into action now ! i hope you feel reassured by your team , but also know that it is your body , your worry , your life and sometimes you ( we ) need to be proactive .....best wishes and happy Christmas x
Posts.Title: Am I being thick ?

Posts.Content: Oh Nutmeg …...that is so good …….after treatment we seem to be abandoned and I feel mentally affected more than physically …. best wishes x
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: the past is history the future is a mystery today is a gift that is why we call it the " present " xx
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Just as the pieces of patchwork are sewn together with interlocking stitches,all the peoples of the world are linked in one fabric........x
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: If you don’t take hold of your fear , your fear takes hold of you .......x
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Nothing like this has happened to me , but I saw you had no replies yet , so I thought I would reply , to let you know that someone is here and empathetic, things can be a nightmare ........can you go home with the Vac ?   I hope someone with knowledge pops up soon , but it does sound complicated and unusual , hope you are getting lots of support , xx
Posts.Title: Flap necrosis, seroma,VAC therapy

Posts.Content: Sometimes I think that the research and treatment is moving on , but the clinical staff explaining this to scared patients need more empathy  , there are so many of us ,and some of us are more scared than others ( ie  me ! )  The way it was explained to me is that mammograms and scans deliver radiation ,and this is cumulative , so has risks as well as clear results bringing reassurance . The oncologist told me that although a new primary in the breast ,or a local recurrence were possible ,she felt there was a good chance (!) that I would find them ,but a clear mammogram which is reassuring does not screen for " secondaries " which is more likely ( in my case )  scary thought ......but medicine is now so research based ,and I suppose they need to do the " best " for the " most " people with the rescources they have , at the same time as minimising harm .......I just wish there was something accurate they could do without squashing my scarred painful boob ......best wishes to you all
Posts.Title: Mammo 50

Posts.Content: Best wishes for your recovery ,sounds like a nightmare ,I have had a few issues post treatment but reading this site reminds me not to moan as I got off lightly. I think a lot of us signed consent forms for all sorts of treatment without dwelling too much ( enough ?)  on the risks / side effects .....I am sure you will get fitter .....we might get a good summer .....
Posts.Title: Back from hospital after DIEP

Posts.Content: Your mum might still be in shock , it took me a good few weeks to “ take it in “ , everyone reacts differently , but I would just say that “ it will be fine / it will be ok / be strong / be positive “ etc etc really drove me to despair and anger ........it will “ take over and thoughts for a bit “ hopefully only a bit .........try to let her deal with it in her own way , let her feel and say what she wants to say , it will get easier .....good luck and best wishes
Posts.Title: BC Mentally Not Coping / Help / Advice

Posts.Content: I can`t help .....I wish I could ,,,,,,but wanted you to know someone is empathising !  The " 5 yr " mammogram has been emotional for others on this site I have seen ,,,,,,somehow we don`t always react the way we thought we would . Now you feel your world is turning upside down again ,,,,and sometimes it is harder to see someone we love be ill than it is to do it ourselves (?)......the dreaded waiting is the worst as you know , best wishes.....
Posts.Title: HELP! I'm turning into someone I don't know.

Posts.Content: Hi crazyknitter ...it’s nightmare isn’t it . The same happened to me , except I has a CT following odd liver enzyme blood results . The next step was a liver biopsy to see if it was the same cancer as the original or had changed Her status ( it hadn’t ) I went straight onto paclitaxol and had a CT again after 9 weeks to see if it was working . It seems to me that all hospitals do things differently . Whatever happens you have not been wicked ,it is cancer that is wicked ! Secondary spread can be managed , you are in the worst part , the waiting ,have you still got a BCN  ? I hope you have got some support ....best wishes
Posts.Title: Breast cancer liver mets

Posts.Content: agree this can be a minefield ....but am using palmers cocoa butter body wash in the shower as a shampoo as well .....and using their moisturiser .....Even before BC  I used Bronsen deodorant !!!  Some Nivea face products are paraben free ,but they change formulations so I have to check each time I re stock......also I am obsessive about not drinking water that is in a " soft "  plastic bottle / been refilled  / stored !!!.....I think I could get quite obsessive if I let myself and the breast care nurse does not " agree "  with any of my precautions ....but I understand none of it has hard research ,so that is fine  !  good luck you find something you like ......
Posts.Title: Parabens, etc

Posts.Content: I can`t help .....I wish I could ....but wanted you to know there are people who empathise !  Being told it will all be alright was the one thing I found MOST  unhelpful .......of course you are scared , the idea that we can be strong all the time is something I really struggle with .....you are living in a nightmare , and feel helpless to control your own life and future and that is scary to say the least.......but as time passes you might feel more positive that there is treatment / help  ? There is emotional help out there as well as physical treatment...at the moment it is all too new and emotional....I hope you have got some friends you can rely on .....I am lucky that way ,but sometimes the only people who " get it "  have " been there "  and if you feel they are all coping better than you it can be lonely .....I really hope you get someone to talk to ,cry as much as you want , accept the way you feel , and the very best wishes  to you ......
Posts.Title: HAS IT SPREAD - TODAYS THE DAY

Posts.Content: There are so many uninsured drivers  , people taking drugs and drink on the roads it is scary ......they don’t care who they hurt . Pleased your granddaughter is ok , but I understand your lymphodema worries , I am so frightened of mine getting worse......have you got a lymphodema clinic ?you will lose some of your no claims too I think ......best wishes ...x
Posts.Title: Accident

Posts.Content: It might help if you think of it this way ......lots of people who take these drugs with little or no side effects might not be appearing on the forum .....forums are always weighted in favour of people needing help / info etc ......you might be one of the lucky ones ......hope you are !
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?

Posts.Content: Yes....my eyes got blurry during chemo , and have not totally recovered , and I have glasses for driving now . There was a thread on this , I think , some time ago …...You are not alone …….best wishes x
Posts.Title: Eyesight problems with EC chemo
